dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6181 RH: To reaffirm that certain land has been taken into trust for the benefit of the Samish Indian Nation, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gallego (for himself, Mr. Aguilar, Mr. Sablan, Mr. Gomez, Mr. Soto, Mr. Cole, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, Mr. Ruiz, Ms. McCollum, Mrs. Torres of California, Mr. LaMalfa, and Mr. Cárdenas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Additional sponsors: Mr. San Nicolas, Ms. Strickland, Mr. Levin of California, Ms. DeGette, Mr. Neguse , Mrs. Napolitano, and Mr. Case
Deleted sponsor: Ms. Strickland, (added February 7, 2022; deleted March 7, 2022)
Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on December 8, 2021

form.official-title: To reaffirm that certain land has been taken into trust for the benefit of the Samish Indian Nation, and for other purposes.

section.text: The applicability of the Act of June 18, 1934 (25 U.S.C. 5101 et seq.; 48 Stat. 984, chapter 576 ) (commonly known as the Indian Reorganization Act) is reaffirmed for the Samish Indian Nation.
Nothing in this Act shall be interpreted as affecting treaty rights under the Treaty of Point Elliott.

bill.official-title-amendment: Amend the title so as to read: A bill to reaffirm the applicability of the Act of June 18, 1934, to the Samish Indian Nation, and for other purposes..

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
